question.questionText: Why was bulb A on when switch Y was open and switch Z was closed?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Bulb A is still contained in a closed path with the battery.
Bulb A is still contained in a closed path with the battery and switch Z.
There is no path containing both switch Y and bulb A
Switch Y and bulb A are not in the same closed path

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: because bulb a was in a closed circuit with the battery
because bulb a was in a closed path with the battery
bulb a is contained in a closed path with the battery.
